instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
This mac has been repaired by another technician in the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> region.  
The mac displays backlight on and then quickly powers off.  Shows USB activity for a few seconds.
I replaced UB300, as it had oxidized components around it. 



Voltage: 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3,4V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> starts with 5V and drops to 300mV
PPBUS 13,07V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3,35V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 3.35V for a few seconds.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message: Did you try SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message: It does not accept SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
All USB ports have the same behavior now?
Still turns off with battery connected?
SSD voltages appear?
